availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Pennsylvnia
County of Philadelphia } S.S.

I Theodore M Morgan duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky resident at Philadelphia, in the State of Pennsylvania do solemnly swear that I will well & faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky.
Sworn and subscribed before me, this Second day of October A D. One thousand eight hundred & sixty two.

James M Calun
alder & J. P.

figure.ab:
THEODORE M MORGAN
COMMISSIONER FOR OF KENTUCKY
PHILADELPHIA PENN

body.p:
Pennsylvania
Comr of Deeds
Oath of Theo. M. Morgan
Filed Octo 6 1862
